Comments_List: A great refresher on material culture theory and anthropological theory in general, the readings were fairly rigorous but were overall worked well together each week
I learned a lot about philosophy, anthropology, and art history all in one class!  It was very meta at first but then became more applicable towards the end
Very interesting topics and material. Interdisciplinary and scope for great projects. Would have liked less dense readings and less focus on theory.

Strengths: Great readings, good discussions, good workload 
Weaknesses: Sometimes discussions didn't quite meet the readings where they needed to, however, this may be more indicative of the class composition than anything else

The readings can be overwhelming for people who aren't experienced with the content, so writing reading responses can be hard.  Maybe a bit more guidance for understanding the readings before we do them would be great.  The presentations and the cool class trips we did were awesome and enriching to the learning experience
Yes! Prof Erami is so kind and engaged. The material is very relevant, interesting and engaging. Have fun with it!
Yes. Professor Erami is wonderful, and she does a great job combining theoretically rigorous/dry readings with fun, practical, and hands-on readings. Also, cheeseboards - what's not to love?
Yes.  Professor Erami is very intelligent, and my mind was consistently blown by the things I learned.  Definitely changed the way I view and understand a lot of things
